query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
1 La molta gente e le diverse piaghe 2 avean le luci mie sì inebrïate, 3 che de lo stare a piangere eran vaghe.
query.result:
**English:**
1 The many people and the diverse afflictions 2 had so inebriated my eyes, 3 that they were eager to remain weeping.
**Sanskrit:**
1 Bahuḥ janaḥ vividhāśca vyādhayaḥ 2 Mama cakṣuṣī tāvat paripīḍitavānti, 3 Yataḥ rodituṃ sthātum icchanti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
4 Ma Virgilio mi disse: «Che pur guate? 5 perché la vista tua pur si soffolge 6 là giù tra l’ombre triste smozzicate?
7 Tu non hai fatto sì a l’altre bolge; 8 pensa, se tu annoverar le credi, 9 che miglia ventidue la valle volge.
query.result:
**English:**
4 But Virgil said to me: "Why do you gaze so intently? 5 Why does your sight sink down among 6 the sad and mangled shades below?
7 You have not done so in the other circles; 8 consider, if you think to count them, 9 that the valley makes a turn of twenty-two miles."
**Sanskrit:**
4 Api tu Virgiliyauvāca: "Kim idam tvayāvalokyate? 5 Kimartham te dṛṣṭiḥ adhastāt patati 6 tatra chāyāḥ śokārtaḥ khaṇḍitāḥ?
7 Tvam anyeṣu valayeṣu evam na cakārṣa; 8 cintaya, yadi tāḥ gaṇayitum icchasi, 9 yathā ayam upatyakāḥ viṃśati-dvau yojana-paridhiḥ vartate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
10 E già la luna è sotto i nostri piedi; 11 lo tempo è poco omai che n’è concesso, 12 e altro è da veder che tu non vedi».
query.result:
**English:**
10 And now the moon is beneath our feet; 11 the time is short that is allotted to us, 12 and there is more to see than you can see.
**Sanskrit:**
10 Eva ca candraḥ adhastāt pādābhyām asmābhiḥ; 11 Kālaḥ alp eva adhunā yaḥ asmābhiḥ prāptaḥ, 12 Anya ca asti draṣṭum yat tvam na paśyasi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
13 «Se tu avessi», rispuos’ io appresso, 14 «atteso a la cagion per ch’io guardava, 15 forse m’avresti ancor lo star dimesso».
query.result:
**English:**
13 "If you had," I answered him then, 14 "paid attention to the reason why I was looking, 15 perhaps you would have already let me go."
**Sanskrit:**
13 "Yadi tvam," aham abraviam tataḥ, 14 "dṛṣṭavān asi kāraṇam yasya aham avalokayāmi, 15 tadā mām adhunā muñcas tvam."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
16 Parte sen giva, e io retro li andava, 17 lo duca, già faccendo la risposta, 18 e soggiugnendo: «Dentro a quella cava
19 dov’ io tenea or li occhi sì a posta, 20 credo ch’un spirto del mio sangue pianga 21 la colpa che là giù cotanto costa».
query.result:
**English:**
16 He departed, and I followed behind him, 17 the leader, already making his reply, 18 and adding: "Within that hollow
19 where I just kept my eyes so intently, 20 I believe a spirit of my own blood weeps 21 for the sin that costs so much down there."
**Sanskrit:**
16 Saḥ jagāma, aham ca tasya paścāt agaccham, 17 neta, pratyuttaram dattva, 18 punar āha: "Tasmin guhāyam
19 yatra aham adhunā akṣīṇi tathā sthāpayām āsa, 20 mama rakta-saṃbandhī ko 'pi ātmā roditi, 21 adhastāt sthitena pāpena, yena atiriktam duḥkham bhujyate."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
28 Tu eri allor sì del tutto impedito 29 sovra colui che già tenne Altaforte, 30 che non guardasti in là, sì fu partito».
query.result:
**English:**
28 You were then so completely victorious 29 over him who once held Altaforte, 30 that you did not look back, so quickly did he depart.
**Sanskrit:**
28 Tvam asi allor saṁpūrṇataḥ pratibandhitaḥ 29 upari tasya yaḥ pūrvam abhavat Altaforte, 30 yaḥ na apaśyatām tatra, tathā saṁvṛttaḥ viyogaḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
31 «O duca mio, la vïolenta morte 32 che non li è vendicata ancor», diss’ io, 33 «per alcun che de l’onta sia consorte,
34 fece lui disdegnoso; ond’ el sen gio 35 sanza parlarmi, sì com’ ïo estimo: 36 e in ciò m’ha el fatto a sé più pio».
query.result:
**English:**
31 "O my leader, the violent death 32 that is not yet avenged for him," I said, 33 "by anyone who shares in the shame,
34 made him disdainful; therefore he went away 35 without speaking to me, as I suppose: 36 and in this he has made me more devoted to him."
**Sanskrit:**
31 "He nāyaka mama, ugrā mṛtyuḥ 32 yasya na pratikṛtā adyāpi," iti aham uvāca, 33 "kena api yaḥ apavādasya bhāgī syāt,
34 tam sa nirviṇṇaḥ cakāra; atas tasya gamanam ajāta, 35 mayā saha na kathitam, yathā aham manye: 36 atra ca sa mama prati adhika-vatsalaḥ kṛtaḥ."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
37 Così parlammo infino al loco primo 38 che de lo scoglio l’altra valle mostra, 39 se più lume vi fosse, tutto ad imo.
query.result:
**English:**
37 Thus we spoke until we reached the first place 38 from which the cliff shows the other valley, 39 if there were more light, all the way to the bottom.
**Sanskrit:**
37 Evam vayam avadam sthānam ādyam yāvat 38 Yataḥ śailo 'nyām akṣṇīm darśayati, 39 Yadi adhikam prakāśaḥ syāt, sarvam adhastāt.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
40 Quando noi fummo sor l’ultima chiostra 41 di Malebolge, sì che i suoi conversi 42 potean parere a la veduta nostra,
43 lamenti saettaron me diversi, 44 che di pietà ferrati avean li strali; 45 ond’ io li orecchi con le man copersi.
query.result:
**English:**
40 When we were above the last cloister 41 of Malebolge, so that its converts 42 could appear to our sight,
43 diverse lamentations pierced me, 44 whose arrows were barbed with pity; 45 so that I covered my ears with my hands.
**Sanskrit:**
40 Yada vayam uttame koṣṭhe āsīma 41 Malebolge, yathā tasya parivṛtāḥ 42 naḥ dṛṣṭau dṛśyante sma,
43 vividhāḥ vilāpāḥ mām abhyahanan, 44 yeṣām śalyāni dayāmayair āyasa-mayair āvṛtāni āsīt; 45 atas aham karābhyām śrotrau ācchādayām āsa.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
46 Qual dolor fora, se de li spedali 47 di Valdichiana tra ’l luglio e ’l settembre 48 e di Maremma e di Sardigna i mali
49 fossero in una fossa tutti ’nsembre, 50 tal era quivi, e tal puzzo n’usciva 51 qual suol venir de le marcite membre.
query.result:
**English:**
46 What sorrow would it be, if from the hospitals 47 of Valdichiana between July and September, 48 and from Maremma and Sardinia, the diseases
49 were all together in one pit, 50 such was it there, and such a stench issued forth 51 as is wont to come from putrid limbs.
**Sanskrit:**
46 Kim duḥkham bhavet, yadi Valdichiana-nāmakasya deśasya ārogyālayeṣu 47 Jūlyamāsatayoḥ madhye 48 Tathā Maremma-Sardinia-deśayoḥ vyādhayaḥ
49 Ekasmin khaṇḍe sarve sametya bhaveyuḥ, 50 Tādṛśam tatra āsīt, tathāvidhaḥ gandhaḥ tatra nirgacchati sma 51 Yathā mṛta-śarīrāṇi yathāsvabhāvam janayanti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
52 Noi discendemmo in su l’ultima riva 53 del lungo scoglio, pur da man sinistra; 54 e allor fu la mia vista più viva
55 giù ver’ lo fondo, la ’ve la ministra 56 de l’alto Sire infallibil giustizia 57 punisce i falsador che qui registra.
query.result:
**English:**
52 We descended onto the last bank 53 of the long cliff, still on the left side; 54 and then my sight was more vivid
55 down towards the bottom, where the minister 56 of the high Lord's infallible justice 57 punishes the falsifiers that she registers here.
**Sanskrit:**
52 Ava-tiryāmaḥ adhastāt tataḥ antima-tīre 53 dīrgha-śilāyāḥ, evaṃ vāma-pārśvataḥ; 54 tataḥ eva adhikaṃ pratyakṣaṃ babhūva mama cakṣuḥ
55 adhastāt patāla-tale, yatra niyuktā 56 parameśvara-rājñaḥ adhokṣaja-nyāya-devatā 57 daṇḍayati mithyāvādi-janaṃ yaḥ atra lipī-kṛtaḥ asti.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
58 Non credo ch’a veder maggior tristizia 59 fosse in Egina il popol tutto infermo, 60 quando fu l’aere sì pien di malizia,
61 che li animali, infino al picciol vermo, 62 cascaron tutti, e poi le genti antiche, 63 secondo che i poeti hanno per fermo,
64 si ristorar di seme di formiche; 65 ch’era a veder per quella oscura valle 66 languir li spirti per diverse biche.
query.result:
**English:**
58 I do not believe that greater sadness could be seen 59 in Aegina, where all the people were sick, 60 when the air was so full of pestilence,
61 that the animals, down to the smallest worm, 62 all perished, and then the ancient people, 63 as the poets firmly believe,
64 were restored from a seed of ants; 65 for it was pitiful to see in that dark valley 66 the spirits languishing from various torments.
**Sanskrit:**
58 Na manye adhikaṃ śokam draṣṭum śakyate 59 Aegināyām samastaḥ prajāḥ ātūrāḥ āsīt, 60 yadā vāyuḥ tathā duṣṭaḥ āsīt,
61 yataḥ paśavaḥ, kṣudra-kīṭa-paryantaḥ, 62 sarve patitāḥ, tataś ca pūrva-janaḥ, 63 yathā kavayaḥ niścitam manyante,
64 pipīlikā-bījena punar-utpannaḥ; 65 yataḥ tasyām andhakāra-maya-khanau draṣṭavyam āsīt 66 ātmānaḥ vividhaiḥ vedanaiḥ pīḍyamānāḥ.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
67 Qual sovra ’l ventre e qual sovra le spalle 68 l’un de l’altro giacea, e qual carpone 69 si trasmutava per lo tristo calle.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Some lay prone on their bellies, and some on their backs, 68 one over the other, and some crawled 69 along the dismal path.
**Sanskrit:**
67 Ke cid udareṇa ke cid skandheṇa 68 Anyo ’nyasya śete, ke cid vā viḍambanam iva 69 Kurvāṇāḥ śocanīye mārge viṣamāyām gatau viṣamāyām caranti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
70 Passo passo andavam sanza sermone, 71 guardando e ascoltando li ammalati, 72 che non potean levar le lor persone.
query.result:
**English:**
70 Step by step we went on without speaking, 71 looking and listening to the sick, 72 who could not lift their bodies.
**Sanskrit:**
70 Padaṃ padaṃ jagāmavaṃ vinā kathanaṃ, 71 paśyantaḥ śṛṇvantaśca rogagrastān, 72 ye na śekuḥ udvartanīṃ kartum sva-śarīrāṇām.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
85 «O tu che con le dita ti dismaglie», 86 cominciò ’l duca mio a l’un di loro, 87 «e che fai d’esse talvolta tanaglie,
88 dinne s’alcun Latino è tra costoro 89 che son quinc’ entro, se l’unghia ti basti 90 etternalmente a cotesto lavoro».
query.result:
**English:**
85 "O you who are tearing yourself with your fingers," 86 my leader began to say to one of them, 87 "and who sometimes make pincers of them,
88 tell us if there is any Latin among these 89 who are here within, if your nails are enough 90 to do this work eternally."
**Sanskrit:**
85 "He bhagavan! Tvam api sva-aṅgulīhi viṣādaṃ kurṣe," 86 mama prabhuḥ ekaṃ tatra sthitaṃ pratyabodhayat, 87 "yadā ca tābhiḥ śaṅku-nibhāḥ karoṣi,
88 asmābhiḥ saha atra sthitaḥ kaścid api Lāṭīnaḥ asti uta neti, yadi tava nakhāḥ 90 nityam etad-vṛttim kartum śaknuyur uta neti."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
91 «Latin siam noi, che tu vedi sì guasti 92 qui ambedue», rispuose l’un piangendo; 93 «ma tu chi se’ che di noi dimandasti?».
query.result:
**English:**
91 "We are Latin spirits, as you see us so wasted 92 here both of us," replied one weeping; 93 "but who are you that have asked about us?"
**Sanskrit:**
91 "Latināḥ smaḥ, yathā asmān paśyasi tathā kṣīṇāḥ 92 atra ubhau," ekaḥ rodiṣṭvā uvāca; 93 "kim punar asi tvam yaḥ asmān papracchasi?"

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
94 E ’l duca disse: «I’ son un che discendo 95 con questo vivo giù di balzo in balzo, 96 e di mostrar lo ’nferno a lui intendo».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the leader said: "I am one who descends 95 with this living man from crag to crag, 96 and I intend to show him Hell."
**Sanskrit:**
94 Evaṃ ca nāyakaḥ uvāca: "Aham asmi yaḥ ava-gacchāmi 95 Asya jīvasya saha adhaḥ padāt padaṃ prati, 96 Evaṃ narakasyadarśanam asya kartavyaṃ manye."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
97 Allor si ruppe lo comun rincalzo; 98 e tremando ciascuno a me si volse 99 con altri che l’udiron di rimbalzo.
query.result:
**English:**
97 Then the common support broke; 98 and trembling, each one turned to me 99 with others who heard it echoing back.
**Sanskrit:**
97 Tatra sādhāraṇo viśvāsaḥ bhagnaḥ; 98 caṇḍīkṛtaśca ekaikaḥ mama abhimukhaḥ āvṛttaḥ, 99 anye ca ye tad ākāśād āgataṃ śrutvā pratyudgacchanti sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
100 Lo buon maestro a me tutto s’accolse, 101 dicendo: «Dì a lor ciò che tu vuoli»; 102 e io incominciai, poscia ch’ei volse:
103 «Se la vostra memoria non s’imboli 104 nel primo mondo da l’umane menti, 105 ma s’ella viva sotto molti soli,
106 ditemi chi voi siete e di che genti; 107 la vostra sconcia e fastidiosa pena 108 di palesarvi a me non vi spaventi».
query.result:
**English:**
100 The good master drew close to me, 101 saying: "Tell them what you wish"; 102 and I began, after he turned to me:
103 "If your memory is not blotted out 104 in the first world from human minds, 105 but if it lives on under many suns,
106 tell me who you are and of what people; 107 let not your unseemly and grievous punishment 108 frighten you from revealing yourselves to me."
**Sanskrit:**
100 Satguruḥ mama sarvam āsamsṛtya, 101 āha: "Bruhi tebhyaḥ yat tvam icchasi"; 102 aham ca ārabdhaḥ, tataḥ saḥ yat pravṛttaḥ:
103 "Yadi tava smṛtiḥ na vināśam gatā 104 prathame loke manuṣya-matibhyaḥ, 105 api tu sā jīvati aneka-sūryānām adhastāt,
106 bruta me ke vayam smaḥ kathamāś ca janaḥ; 107 mama prati tava duṣṭā ca duḥkha-janakā ca śikṣā 108 mā tvām bhayāt sparśatu mama prati prakāśane."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
109 «Io fui d’Arezzo, e Albero da Siena», 110 rispuose l’un, «mi fé mettere al foco; 111 ma quel per ch’io mori’ qui non mi mena.
query.result:
**English:**
109 "I was from Arezzo, and Alberto da Siena," 110 replied one of them, "had me put to the stake; 111 but that for which I died does not bring me here.
**Sanskrit:**
109 Ahamarāvāsaḥ, Alberascaiva Sainikaḥ, 110 Pratyuvācaikas tatra, mama dagdhasya kāraṇam, 111 Na tu mama mṛtyukāraṇam ihānayati.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
112 Vero è ch’i’ dissi lui, parlando a gioco: 113 “I’ mi saprei levar per l’aere a volo”; 114 e quei, ch’avea vaghezza e senno poco,
115 volle ch’i’ li mostrassi l’arte; e solo 116 perch’ io nol feci Dedalo, mi fece 117 ardere a tal che l’avea per figliuolo.
query.result:
**English:**
112 True it is that I said to him, speaking in jest: 113 "I would know how to lift myself up into the air in flight"; 114 and he, who had a desire but little sense,
115 wanted me to show him the art; and only 116 because I did not make him a Daedalus, he caused me 117 to be burned by one who held him as a son.
**Sanskrit:**
112 Satyam eva aham tasmai uvāca, parihāsena bruvāṇaḥ: 113 "Aham jānāmi utpatitum ākāśe patanaṃ kṛtvā"; 114 sa ca, yasya āsīt icchā, prajñā tu alpā,
115 icchata sma yathā aham tasmai silpam darśayem; kevalam ca 116 yasmāt aham tam Daedalum na cakāra, tasmāt sa 117 māṃ dāhayām āsa tena, yaḥ tam putratvena dhārayati sma.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
118 Ma ne l’ultima bolgia de le diece 119 me per l’alchìmia che nel mondo usai 120 dannò Minòs, a cui fallar non lece».
query.result:
**English:**
118 But in the last pouch of the ten 119 Minos condemned me for the alchemy 120 that I practiced in the world, and he cannot err.
**Sanskrit:**
118 Api tu daśamasyāḥ kuṇḍasya ante 119 Mām alchīmiyayā jagati prayuktāyāḥ 120 Minos adaṇḍayat, yasya vipralipsatvam na vidyate.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
121 E io dissi al poeta: «Or fu già mai 122 gente sì vana come la sanese? 123 Certo non la francesca sì d’assai!».
query.result:
**English:**
121 And I said to the poet: "Was there ever 122 a people as vain as the Sienese? 123 Certainly the French are not so, by far!"
**Sanskrit:**
121 Ahaṃ ca kavinam avocatam: "Kim pūrvam abhūt 122 janaḥ śūnyaḥ iva saṃghaḥ sainaḥ iva? 123 Na khalu frāṃsīyāḥ tathā atiśayena."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
124 Onde l’altro lebbroso, che m’intese, 125 rispuose al detto mio: «Tra’mene Stricca 126 che seppe far le temperate spese,
127 e Niccolò che la costuma ricca 128 del garofano prima discoverse 129 ne l’orto dove tal seme s’appicca;
130 e tra’ne la brigata in che disperse 131 Caccia d’Ascian la vigna e la gran fonda, 132 e l’Abbagliato suo senno proferse.
query.result:
**English:**
124 Whereupon the other leper, who heard me, 125 replied to my words: "Bring to my mind Stricca, 126 who knew how to make moderate expenses,
127 and Niccolò, who first discovered 128 the costly custom of the clove 129 in the garden where such a seed is planted;
130 and bring to my mind the company in which 131 Caccia d'Ascian squandered his vineyard and his great wealth, 132 and Abbagliato offered his wit.
**Sanskrit:**
124 Tatraanyaḥ kuṣṭhī yaḥ mama vacanaṃ śuśrāva, 125 mama uktaye pratyuttaram adāt: "Mama smaraṇaṃ kuru Striccaṃ, 126 yaḥ mitaṃ vyayam kartum ajānāt,
127 tathā Niccolòṃ yaḥ prathamam lauṅgasya 128 mūlyavān ācāraḥ prākaśayām āsa 129 udyāne yasmin tādṛśaṃ bījam vardhate;
130 tathā mama smaraṇaṃ kuru saṃghasya yasmin 131 Caccia d'Ascian sva-dṛākṣārāmam mahā-nidhim ca vyasanāt vināśayām āsa, 132 tathā Abbagliatoḥ sva-prajñām adarśayat.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Sanskrit.
133 Ma perché sappi chi sì ti seconda 134 contra i Sanesi, aguzza ver’ me l’occhio, 135 sì che la faccia mia ben ti risponda:
136 sì vedrai ch’io son l’ombra di Capocchio, 137 che falsai li metalli con l’alchìmia; 138 e te dee ricordar, se ben t’adocchio,
139 com’ io fui di natura buona scimia».
query.result:
**English:**
133 But so that you may know who thus seconds you 134 against the Sienese, sharpen your eyes towards me, 135 so that my face may answer you well:
136 you will see that I am the shade of Capocchio, 137 who falsified metals with alchemy; 138 and you should remember, if I look at you closely,
139 how I was by nature a good ape.
**Sanskrit:**
133 Api tu jñātum arhasi kaḥ evam tvām anugṛhṇāti 134 Sanebhyaḥ prati, mama prati cakṣuḥ tejanaya, 135 yathā mama vaktram tava śubham pratipadyate:
136 evam drakṣyasi yathā aham Capocchio-chāyā asmi, 137 yaḥ rasān rasavādena mithyā cakāra; 138 ca tvām smartavyam, yadi aham tava prati dṛṣṭipātam gacchāmi,
139 katham aham svabhāvataḥ śreṣṭhaḥ vānarāḥ āsam.
